node.title: For Arbery’s Family and Friends, a Time of Anguish and Activism
node.description: With closing arguments set to begin in the trial of three men accused of killing Ahmaud Arbery, those closest to him have kept a prayerful vigil at the courthouse.

node.title: Australia will allow some visa holders to return in December.
node.description: The country will allow skilled workers and international students to enter next month, the government announced.

node.title: Man Hit With Dog Bone Suffers Fractured Skull in Pet Store Face Mask Argument, Police Say
node.description: The victim of the attack, which occurred in a PetSmart Store in Las Vegas, suffered a fractured skull and a severed artery.

node.title: Donald Trump's Former Ally Chris Christie Called Rudy Giuliani a 'National Embarrassment'
node.description: In this daily series, Newsweek explores the steps that led to the January 6 Capitol Riot.

node.title: Family or freedom: Australia leaves Afghan interpreters with impossible choice
node.description: Hundreds of former interpreters remain in hiding across Afghanistan, but escape to Australia still comes with a cost.

node.title: Kyle Rittenhouse says he's not racist and he backs BLM
node.description: Tells Fox News' Tucker Carlson his case "never had anything to do with race. It had to do with the right to self-defense."

node.title: Manchester United and the Perils of Living in the Past
node.description: Years of success under Alex Ferguson changed the way United viewed itself. But the glory days are gone, and the sooner the club admits that, the better.

node.title: The Secret Is, 'Everybody Gets Rich Except the People Who Put Money In'
node.description: How hedge funds and private equity firms exploit workers' retirement savings.

node.title: Pennsylvania Bear Hunter Shot Dead on First Day of Open Season
node.description: Gary R. Hunt is believed to have been shot after his hunting companion tripped and fell, accidentally causing a firearm to discharge.

node.title: Woodside's $16b Scarborough gas project gets green light
node.description: The final go-ahead to build the biggest oil and gas development in Australia in a decade has been given by Woodside and BHP, after reaching a final investment decision on the $16.5 billion Scarborough project off north-west Western Australia. But green groups vow to keep fighting the plan.

node.title: 'Four beautiful kids are gone, forever': Relatives share grief as Werribee house fire victims identified
node.description: The deaths of 10-year-old Hamid Turgem, six-year old Esin Turgem, three-year-old Nadir Turgem and one-year-old Elaine Turgem are mourned as relatives share how surviving sibling, Ibrahim, alerted his parents to the fire in their home on Sunday.

node.title: BTS the big winners at the American Music Awards
node.description: The South Korean superstars won artist of the year and favorite pop duo or group, and their "Butte" was named favorite pop song. Taylor Swift set a record with her 34th career AMA win.

node.title: A New Search for Jimmy Hoffa
node.description: A deathbed statement by a man who claimed to have buried Hoffa’s body, repeated years later by his son, sent the F.B.I. to Jersey City for a “site survey.”

node.title: Kyle Rittenhouse Faces People Out There Who 'Want to Hurt Him,' Mother Says
node.description: Wendy Rittenhouse said her son just wants to be a "normal kid" and go to school, but acknowledged that it is going to be "different for him."

node.title: Tucker Carlson Delighted as Jonah Golberg, Stephen Hayes Quit Fox—'Viewers Will be Happy'
node.description: Jonah Goldberg and Stephen Hayes called Tucker Carlson's Capitol riot special "a collection of incoherent conspiracy-mongering."

node.title: Two kidnapped US missionaries freed amidst kidnapping epidemic in Haiti
node.description: More than 800 people have been kidnapped for ransom since the start of 2021 in Haiti, with the United States and Canada warning citizens to leave the country over fears they could be targeted.

node.title: Austria enters nationwide lockdown to fight soaring cases
node.description: Austria powers down public life on Monday as its fourth national COVID-19 lockdown begins, making it the first western European country to reimpose the drastic and unpopular measure this autumn in the face of surging coronavirus infections.

node.title: Here's what we know about the Christmas parade tragedy in Waukesha, Wisconsin
node.description: Waukesha, in the midwestern state of Wisconsin, was celebrating its 58th annual holiday parade when an SUV ploughed through dozens of performers, killing at least five people.

node.title: Netflix Turns Its Attention to Films It Hopes Everyone Wants to See
node.description: The streaming service wants to be more than a place where big names bring passion projects studios have passed on. It’s now trying to make the kind of blockbusters normally seen in theaters.

node.title: 55 Years Ago, He Shot Malcolm X. Now He Lives Quietly in Brooklyn.
node.description: Mujahid Abdul Halim is the one man who confessed to his role in the assassination. He long insisted that the two men convicted with him were innocent.

node.title: Five Dead After Driver Plows S.U.V. Into Holiday Parade in Wisconsin
node.description: Officials said dozens of people were struck after the vehicle sped down the street during the Christmas parade in Waukesha, Wis., near Milwaukee.

node.title: As Thanksgiving Approaches, U.S. Virus Cases Tick Upward Once More
node.description: Cases are rising again in parts of the country, but more people are traveling, and health officials have largely stopped telling people to skip celebrations.

node.title: Limping and Penniless, Iraqis Deported From Belarus Face Bleak Futures
node.description: Hundreds of desperate Iraqis are being sent home after becoming political pawns in Belarus’s quarrel with its European Union neighbors.

node.title: Aussie great backs Cummins to replace Paine as Test captain
node.description: Adam Gilchrist says Pat Cummins deserves the chance to captain the Australian men's Test XI in the Ashes after Tim Paine's resignation over a sexting scandal.

node.title: Patient accused of punching GP for refusing vaccine exemption
node.description: Queensland doctors say threats against staff are on the rise amid fear among some people about the impacts vaccine mandates will have on their lives.

node.title: Prime Minister forced to backtrack after claiming he told opposition about Hawaiian holiday
node.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison claimed he had told the opposition he was headed to Hawaii during the catastrophic bushfires in 2019 — only to be made to clarify his comments twice just hours later.

node.title: Family of Melbourne woman who died after 'unnecessary' CT scan calls for change
node.description: A lawyer for the family of Melbourne mother-of-two Peta Hickey says they intend to launch civil action after the Victorian coroner finds doctors' poor judgement, inadequate training and lax industry standards contributed to the death.

node.title: New Zealand to move away from COVID zero, Air New Zealand cancels 1,000 Australian flights
node.description: New Zealand will end a three-and-a-half-month lockdown in Auckland next week as it adopts a new coronavirus control strategy, Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern says. It comes as Air New Zealand cancels 1,000 flights to Australia.

node.title: Cyclist dies after colliding with truck on SH6, Wakefield
node.description: A cyclist has died after colliding with a truck in Wakefield, Tasman District this afternoon.

node.title: Public servants offered $10,000 'bonus' as hundreds of staff sacked for refusing COVID jab in NT
node.description: To get public servants to agree to a four-year pay freeze, NT Chief Minister Michael Gunner is offering a $10,000 "bonus" which would be funded using the salaries of staff recently sacked for refusing to get vaccinated.
